page.title: 17VILLAGE ATTITUDES
page.content: Many young people in this area think that there is not enough to occupy them,that the Youth club caters only for young teenagers and the public house is the only place left. Night clubs and Discos are to be found in Sheffield but that is 7 miles away and late night transport is a problem. The elderly in the area look back with nostalgia,remembering the village as it was,small,stone built,where every one knew each other and life centred around the church,chapel or school. The young parents would like a nursery school attached to Oughtibridge,cuts in authority spending prevent this. The middle aged residents are concerned by the continual building of new dwellings in the area and the increase in traffic on the main road.
